body_html: TensorFlow was largely motivated by our previous gen DL framework and applications at that time. Then, double was frowned upon by DL community for its slowness and the extra precision was not needed by those models. int64 & float64 on GPUs were also very slow and virtually nobody cared. So, int32 & float32 were more defacto data types.

body: TensorFlow was largely motivated by our previous gen DL framework and applications at that time. Then, double was frowned upon by DL community for its slowness and the extra precision was not needed by those models. int64 & float64 on GPUs were also very slow and virtually nobody cared. So, int32 & float32 were more defacto data types.
